abstract.text: A reference to a localizable string, accessible from another process.

inlineContent.text: to provide localizable strings with lookups you defer to a later time.
When you create a localized string or a localized attributed string with an initializer that takes
, those initializers lookup the localized string immediately. If you want to perform the lookup at a later time, use this
type to refer to the localizable strings. Then, when you need to perform localization, create a
from an initializer that takes a
This approach allows you to provide localizable strings to an entirely separate process, which may use a different locale. For example, consider an app with a data model type called
This app (or one of its embedded frameworks) then uses these
members to defer looking up localized strings. Typically, this happens when calling out to another process over XPC.

code: // Send text to another process via XPC or similar.

inlineContent.text: Then, when the other process receives the call, it can alter the
, prior to resolving the localized strings.

code: // Set resource locales to match the current locale

inlineContent.text: to perform a late resolution of localized strings. This allows the Siri UI to potentially use different localization preferences than the app providing the intent.

abstract.text: Returns a localized string from a table that Xcode generates for you when exporting localizations.
A type that provides an out-of-process localizable description.
Information about linguistic, cultural, and technological conventions for use in formatting data for presentation.
A reference to a localizable string, accessible from another process.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.
The bundle containing the table’s strings file.
The resource’s default value.
Encodes this value into the given encoder.
Creates a localized string resource from a static string and its bundle properties.
Creates a localized string resource from a localization key and its bundle properties.
Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.
The key to use to look up a localized string.
The locale to use to look up the localized string from the string resource.
A resource that helps provide a description of the instance.
The name of the table containing the key-value pairs.
Creates an instance initialized to the given value.
Creates a localized string resource from the given string interpolation.
Creates a localized string resource from the specified string literal.
Creates an instance initialized to the given value.
The location of a bundle to use for looking up localized strings, such as the main bundle, or a bundle at a specific file URL.
The type that extended grapheme cluster literal initializers use.
The type to use for string interpolation for creating localized string resources.
The type that string literal initializers use.
The type that Unicode scalar literal initializers use.
A description of the linguistic content of natural language text, typically used for spelling and grammar checking.
A resource located at a particular file URL within a bundle.
